title: Fact Check: Don’t fall for this collage claiming that JNUSU President faked hand injury | Newsmobile
author: newsmobile.in
vclaim:
Following the violence in Jawaharlal Nehru University (JNU) on January 5, a set of pictures is making rounds on social media featuring JNU Students’ Union President, Aishe Ghosh.

In the two pictures, Ghosh can be seen with a plaster on her hand. In one picture the plaster can be seen on the left hand, while in the other picture the plaster can be seen on her right hand.

In the caption, it was claimed that Aishe was faking her injury.

Day 1 (Odd day) – Left Hand in Plaster

 Day 2 (Even day) – Right Hand in Plaster”

NewsMobile fact-checked the above post and found it to be misleading as one of the two pictures is morphed.

On putting the picture, in which she is speaking, through Reverse Image Search, we came across the original picture, which shows that the plaster on Aishe’s left hand.

The above picture was taken while Aishe was addressing the media on January 6th, 2019, a day after the violence broke out on the campus.

In the above FAKE vs REAL collage, it is clear that the original picture was flipped to create a false narative.

NewsMobile was also present during Aishe’s press briefing and in the above video, the plaster can be seen on her left hand.

Hence, the above information proves that the viral set of pictures with the attached claim is misleading.

If you want to fact-check any story, WhatsApp it now on +91 88268 00707
